item.title: Ticket #32 (Calendar makes no use of option "start_of_week") updated
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description: I found out that the patch doesn't work with the CVS version of files. in fact, it seems like either the server or me makes the file unpatchable at all w/o modifications. So in the next few days (i'll be away tomorrow and on sunday), I'll make another diff and put it here in a gzipped form. I HOPE that WILL go into the CVS.

item.title: Ticket #187 (User level limit on plugins page wrong) created
item.dc:creator: erikD
item.description:
When you are user level 8 and try to access the plugins you get a message saying you must be at least user level 8. The following code in wp-plugins(line 32) shows the problem:

if ($user_level < 9) Must be at least level 9

die (("Sorry, you must be at least a level 8 user to modify plugins."));

The bug is in both 1.2 and the current CVS

item.title: Changeset [1478]: Options system can now transparently handle arrays and objects.
item.dc:creator: saxmatt
item.description: Options system can now transparently handle arrays and objects.

item.title: Changeset [1477]: Rev of installer. Friendlier and better setup. Still needs error ...
item.dc:creator: saxmatt
item.description: Rev of installer. Friendlier and better setup. Still needs error checking on admin_email and weblog title, real magic quotes handling, and to use an external DB structure to check everything.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description: Either attempt a login or logout. The majority of cases will just see the last page being reloaded again.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) created
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description:
When using the current WP 1.3-CVS under PHP5.0.1-dev with Apache-SSL1.3.29, wp-login.php is non-functional as discussed here: ​http://wordpress.org/support/2/8750#post-10

Upon further digging, the Apache process will actually crash (other processes remain OK however) but there is nothing regarding what PHP error was actually encountered.

The function appears to be broken in both the login and logout context as the quirk exists in both situations.

item.title: Ticket #184 (Number of posts in feeds setting not quite right) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
Duplicate bug! Sorry about this.

Please close this bug, or refer to bug #183 (​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/bug_view_page.php?bug_id=0000183)

item.title: Ticket #184 (Number of posts in feeds setting not quite right) created
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
The options->Reading option page says that one can set the number of posts to be displayed in the feeds.

However, if someone selects "days" instead of "posts" for the option related to posts displayed on index.php, then the RSS feeds use this option too.

In short:

If the setting for posts on index.php is Show most recent "20" "days"

Then , if the setting for feeds is Show most recent "10" posts

The feeds show the most recent 10 days' posts, not the most recent 10 posts.

item.title: Ticket #183 (RSS unit erroneously based on Front Page unit (days/posts).) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When setting Syndication options under Options -> Reading, if the units for the Front Page most recent posts is set to "days", then the unit for Syndication Feeds is also set to "days", even though it appears to be hard-coded to "posts".

item.title: Ticket #182 (Setting the default category for posts works inconsistently) created
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
If you set the default category using Options ->Writing, the if you also use the advanced edit screen for your posts, then setting the default category works. If you use the 'simple controls' then it does not, by which I mean that the default category setting made in the options page is ignored.

This seems inconsistent.

item.title: Ticket #181 (Sanitize titles should remove HTML) created
item.dc:creator: offline
item.description: If a title includes HTML, there's no reason for the tags to find themselves in the final product. It should be just another regex -- in fact, I thought I had one that worked, but it just returned a blank post slug.
